# UUID Entities Example

Using UUID primary keys instead of auto-increment integers.

## Entity with UUID

```go
package models

import "github.com/tracewayapp/go-lightning/lpg"

type Entity struct {
    Id          string  // UUID stored as string
    Name        string
    Description string
}

func init() {
    lpg.Register[Entity]()
}
```

## Auto-Generated UUID

```go
entity := &Entity{
    Name:        "My Entity",
    Description: "Description here",
}

// Generates UUID automatically
uuid, err := lpg.InsertGenericUuid(tx, entity)
if err != nil {
    log.Fatal(err)
}

fmt.Printf("Generated UUID: %s\n", uuid)
fmt.Printf("Entity ID: %s\n", entity.Id)  // Same as uuid
```

## Pre-Generated UUID

```go
import "github.com/google/uuid"

entity := &Entity{
    Id:          uuid.New().String(),
    Name:        "My Entity",
    Description: "Description",
}

err := lpg.InsertGenericExistingUuid(tx, entity)
if err != nil {
    log.Fatal(err)
}
```

## PostgreSQL Schema

```sql
CREATE TABLE entities (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    name TEXT NOT NULL,
    description TEXT
);
```

## MySQL Schema

```sql
CREATE TABLE entities (
    id CHAR(36) PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT
);
```

See [PostgreSQL Guide](/guides/postgresql#uuid-support) for more details.
